answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some sample Terms and Conditions links.
This list from York County, SC includes calendars under its Use of Communications Services subtitle.
http://www.yorkcountygov.com/Terms.aspx
I found a similar link from Pinellas County, FL. It includes a section for the Use of Bulletin Board, or any Other Communication or Interactive Forums.
http://www.pinellascounty.org/disclaimer.htm
I also included a general website terms and conditions page from the Township of Toms River, NJ.
http://tomsrivertownship.com/index.php/terms-a-conditions.html
Also, here are two general guidelines and tips for creating such terms and conditions.
http://www.nolo.com/legal-encyclopedia/website-terms-conditions-29759.html
http://www.businesslink.gov.uk/bdotg/action/detail?itemId=1076142035&type=RESOURCES
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Ashley Greiber
text:
The Village of Waunakee is in the process of implementing a new website.  The new site allows residents to submit events for the Village wide calendar.  We are interested in knowing what terms and conditions others have used for the process of deciding what events are appropriate to post.
Any information would be helpful.
title: Calendar Event Postings
